value.title: Fauci Says Biden's 'Strikingly Different Tone' on COVID Crisis Will Rev Up Vaccination Efforts
value.excerpt: "Instead of pointing fingers and making blame, we're going to try and fix it," the nation's top infectious disease expert said.

value.title: Mine just south of Oregon-Nevada line may boost Joe Biden’s energy plan
value.excerpt: One of the keys to President Joe Biden’s $2 trillion clean energy plan could be a mineral that lies in a salt flat above a prehistoric volcano just south of the Oregon-Nevada line.

value.title: FEMA would operate up to 100 federally run mass vaccination sites under Biden plan
value.excerpt: A draft FEMA document envisions four different models for sites, with the largest capable of handling 6,000 doses a day.

value.title: Biden says we need to act 'decisively and boldly'
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden said on Friday the U.S. economic crisis was deepening and that the government needs to take major action now to help struggling Americans.

value.title: Biden plans to sign executive orders boosting workers' rights and pushing for a $15 minimum wage for federal staff
value.excerpt: Biden is set to sign an order on Friday ensuring that people can still claim unemployment benefits if they turn down a job because of COVID-19 risks.

value.title: In first lawsuit against Biden administration, Texas AG Paxton challenges deportation freeze
value.excerpt: Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton asked a federal judge to block a new Biden administration policy that pauses most deportations for the next 100 days.

value.title: Georgia Black women leaders on 'saving democracy' by helping flip Senate, fueling Biden-Harris win
value.excerpt: It’s almost like someone has wiped the darkness away and given us new light,” a voter registration organizer said.

value.title: Biden seeks five-year extension of New START arms treaty with Russia: source
value.excerpt: U.S. President Joe Biden will seek a five-year extension to the New START arms control treaty with Russia, a source familiar with the matter said on Thursday.

value.title: Biden demands decency, promising staff members 'I will fire you on the spot' if they disrespect others
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden conducted a swearing-in ceremony by video conference Wednesday with hundreds of new government staff members.

value.title: Charlottesville Inspired Biden to Run. Now It Has a Message for Him.
value.excerpt: The white supremacist rally in 2017 prefigured the rise of right-wing violence in President Trump’s name. Now, as President Biden calls for national unity, residents say it requires accountability first.

value.title: LIVE UPDATES: Anti-Biden Antifa protesters take to the streets in Portland, Seattle overnight
value.excerpt: At least eight adults were arrested for crimes ranging from rioting and possession of a destructive device to reckless burning.

value.title: ‘Celebrating America’ review: Earnest inauguration special encapsulates President Joe Biden
value.excerpt: Celebrating America” traded the usual inauguration night balls for socially distanced performances from around the country, spotlights of “everyday heroes,” and solemn acknowledgments of the extraordinarily tough few years the country has muscled through to get to this moment.

value.title: 'This is our historic moment of crisis and challenge': Joe Biden calls for unity in first speech as president – live
value.excerpt: Joe Biden has been sworn in as president, bringing an end to four years of Donald Trump’s leadership in Washington

value.title: Joe Biden Invokes Lincoln in Plea for Unity, an End to 'Uncivil War'
value.excerpt: Biden asked those who didn't support him as president to give him a chance and urged people to open their souls and show tolerance.

value.title: Pence heading back to Indiana hometown after Biden inaugural
value.excerpt: Vice President Mike Pence will be returning to his southern Indiana hometown Wednesday afternoon following the inauguration of President-elect Joe Biden

value.title: Iran's nuclear 'breakout time' has shrunk to three-four months, Biden's top diplomat pick says
value.excerpt: The time it would take Iran to make enough fissile material for a single nuclear weapon has fallen to three or four months from over a year under the 2015 Iran nuclear deal, President-elect Joe Biden's choice to be the top U.

value.title: Watch live: Biden nominee for DHS Director testifies at confirmation hearing
value.excerpt: President-elect Joe Biden's nominee for Director of the Department of Homeland Security Alejandro Mayorkas on Tuesday morning is slated to testify at his Senate confirmation hearing.The hearing is scheduled to begin at 10 a.

value.title: When Joe Biden Takes the White House, He’ll Also Take @WhiteHouse
value.excerpt: Biden Jr. completes his transition into the White House, several social media companies will be completing their own transitions of highly followed official accounts. But the handoff won’t be as seamless as it was four years ago,

value.title: Joe Biden's Options for Dealing with Donald Trump Are Worse than Watergate
value.excerpt: When it comes to Donald Trump, the incoming president has a critical decision to make about the best way to move the country forward—and neither Democrats nor Republicans are likely to be happy about his choice.

value.title: Gen. Milley key to military continuity as Biden takes office
value.excerpt: When the incoming Biden administration takes charge of a Pentagon rocked by four years of leadership churn, it’ll look mainly to one holdover to provide continuity

value.title: Politics updates: 'Horrified' Loews won't host Hawley fundraiser; Biden outlines orders planned for first 10 days
value.excerpt: "We are horrified and opposed to the events at the Capitol and all who supported and incited the actions," the hotel chain said in a statement.

value.title: Biden: We'll 'manage the hell' out of feds' COVID response
value.excerpt: President-elect Joe Biden is pledging to boost supplies of coronavirus vaccine and set up new vaccination sites to meet his goal of 100 million shots in 100 days

value.title: Biden: Science will be at `forefront' of his administration
value.excerpt: President-elect Joe Biden says “science will always be at the forefront of my administration,” and he's elevating the post of science adviser to Cabinet level, a White House first

value.title: Police: Man charged after displaying ‘KILL BIDEN’ sign
value.excerpt: A Virginia man has been arrested for having a “KILL BIDEN” sign. WWBT in Richmond reported Thursday that Kenneth Kraig Thomas of Goochland County was arrested and is facing a charge of threatening a person in writing.

value.title: Biden announces former FDA head David Kessler as chief science officer for vaccine drive to stop spread of coronavirus
value.excerpt: Biden announces former FDA head David Kessler as chief science officer for vaccine drive to stop spread of coronavirus

value.title: Joe Biden unveils $1.9tn US economic relief package
value.excerpt: President-elect Joe Biden has unveiled a $1.9tn (£1.4tn) stimulus plan for the coronavirus-sapped US economy before he takes office next week. If passed by Congress, it would include $1tn for households,

value.title: Fact Check: Was a Biden Campaign Official Arrested?
value.excerpt: A woman was arrested in Texas on multiple counts of voter fraud, causing social media users to make claims about who she was working for.

value.title: Biden picks Samantha Power, former UN envoy, for US aid post
value.excerpt: President-elect Joe Biden has selected Samantha Power, the U.S. ambassador to the United Nations under President Barack Obama, to run the U.S. Agency for International Development

value.title: Chicago Man Who Threatened to 'Kill' Democrats, Prevent Biden From Entering White House Arrested
value.excerpt: Louis Capriotti, a 45-year-old man from Chicago, made the alleged threats in a voicemail to a representative from New Jersey.

value.title: Biden chooses veteran diplomat William Burns as his CIA director
value.excerpt: William Burns, chosen by Biden to head the CIA, built a 33-year career at the State Department under both Republican and Democratic presidents.
